acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.055mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 33mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation of dust) value of 0.48mg/L (4 hours) (HSDB (2006)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 72mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 72mg/kg (RTECS (2006)) and 175mg/kg (HSDB (2006)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=0.94(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available on substances with melting point of <55degC (melting point: 35-36degC, Merck (13th, 2001)).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data (no data available on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 35-36degC, Merck (13th, 2001), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions in the reports on rabbit eye irritation tests: "Strongly irritating" (HSDB (2006)) and "severe" (RTECS (2006)). The substance is thus considered a strong eye irritant.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the descriptions in the reports on rabbit skin irritation tests: "Moderate" (though the results are those of 24 (not 4) hour application) (RTECS (2006)) and "strongly irritating" (exposure duration unknown) (HSDB (2006)). The substance is thus considered a moderate skin irritant.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 2 (salivary gland, respiratory system, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (salivary gland, respiratory system, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "somnolency (reduced systemic activity), structural and functional changes in the salivary gland," "structural and functional changes in the trachea or bronchi" (RTECS (2006)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2. However, since the referenced databases are assigned a priority rating of 2, these effects are classified into Category 2 (salivary gland, respiratory organs, nervous system).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 2 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Based on the human evidence including "convulsions or effects on the convulsion threshold, changed locomotor activity and coma" (RTECS 2006), "Over 240 individuals reported symptoms such as eye and throat irritation, dizziness, and shortness of breath" (HSDB (2003)).
As the referenced databases are assigned a priority rating of 2, these effects are classified into Category 2 (central nervous system) and Category 3 (respiratory irritation).
